pullRequest.title: DBZ-2495 Updating to handle captured_column_list without specifying column.exclude.list
pullRequest.bodyText:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/DBZ-2495
Additional Changes:
Fixed the SqlServerSnapshotChangeEventSource#checkExcludedColumns to actually filter Previously it was just adding all the columns regardless and not utilizing the filters properly.
Fixed Testing.Debug#disable to flip the flag to false.
Removed private Table sourceTable; from SqlServerChangeTable as it was hiding the underlying sourceTable in ChangeTable.

afterCommit.message: DBZ-2495 Updating to handle captured_column_list without specify column.exclude.list

nodes.bodyText: Can be final? Also simply capturedColumns would be preferred, no need to encode the type into the name (same for the getter exposing it).
This will make the map not big enough due to the default load factor, triggering a re-size if all columns are added. I wouldn't bother and just call new HashMap<>().
Could you also update SqlServerConnectorIT#excludeColumnWhenCaptureInstanceExcludesColumns() and remove the filter? As discussed in the Jira issue, this should not be needed any longer with your fix.

afterCommit.message: DBZ-2495 Updating tables to utilize Table.editor for creating new tables

commit.message: DBZ-2495 Updating to handle captured_column_list without specify column.exclude.list
DBZ-2495 Updating tables to utilize Table.editor for creating new tables

nodes.bodyText: IMHO this should not be done in constructor but on the caller side. The string encoding is the stored procedure implementation detail and should not leak into logical representation of the capture table.

afterCommit.message: DBZ-2495 Moving string splitting logic out of constructor

commit.message: DBZ-2495 Moving string splitting logic out of constructor

nodes.bodyText: Can we still keep it in a separate method?

This is very similar to the code in https://github.com/debezium/debezium/pull/1822/files#diff-d9a5092f0eb1f68e8881b17b09f25827R106
Can't it be extracted into a utility method shared?
This is just a technical method, I don't think this belongs to the interface. Is not this unnecessary code optimization?
Nice, this was bothering me, too :)
So in which case would greatestColumnPosition be different from the width of the result set (ignoring any +/-1 difference due to indexing based on 0 vs. 1)?
